result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on August 24, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Pre-trial conference on August 24, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with EMR, JMR, or EM. 
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol. 
- Defendant shall not be in the 0-100 block of Granby Cir. 
Trial Judge - Br 13

10:58 AM Defendant appeared.  Trisha L Simmons appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Jim Larson interpreted. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  The defendant will need an interpreter for future court appearances.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
